text: Japheth waits. He keeps himself busy with a stick. He senses something, looks up. The Raven approaches.

THE RAVEN! If’S COME BACK! Everyone rushes out. Ila carries a huge weight and is extremely tired. Noah walks to the edge of the roof and stretches out his hand. The Raven lands on his forearm. It blinks. He examines its feet.  101.
No mud. No dirt. Nothing. (to Naameh) The Creator waits for the birth. The Raven flaps down to the roof. Noah goes inside. Tla cries on Shem’s shoulder.
Shh now. Courage. When it is our child’s time, we will be away from here.
Away? There’s nowhere for us to go.
We will find a way. I promise.
(tearful, hopeful, desperate) Maybe it will be a boy?
Maybe. But Noah shall never know. After a moment.

Come, inside now. Shem leads her inside. She can’t stop crying. Japheth watches them go. He looks over at the Raven. He bends to pick it up but the big black bird snaps at him. curt To: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Japheth sneaks inside. He picks up the bowl of herbs and a flint stone and heads into the

He looks at the different birds. So many to choose from. Then he spots the doves. Our DOVE. He sparks the incense. He blows smoke toward the Dove.  102. Slowly, the bird awakes. It ruffles it’s feathers.
ILA’S HUT Ila rests, still erying.
Sister?
Japheth. The young boy enters with the Dove.
My dove? You woke it.
Yes.
Father will be angry.
Angrier than he already is? Ila accepts this.
The raven is smart, maybe too smart.
What do you mean?

Maybe he sees all the water and gives up. The dove is more simple. His eyes are. not as good as the raven’s but he always flies home. He will never give up until he gets there. Maybe he will go further and find us land. She doesn’t hold much faith in the idea, but her brother’s love have dried her tears. She hugs him.
Thank you, brother. cur To:
Japheth walks out into the daylight. The Raven SQUAWKS at him. He ignores it and let’s the Dove go, The bird flies straight and true towards the setting sun. FADE TO BLACK.
At night, floating on a black sea. No stars only clouds.

Everyone sleeps. The animals sleep. The reptiles, the birds, the mammals - everything. Noah sleeps on the floor in his workshop. Naameh sleeps alone on a bed made for two. Japheth sleeps on the roof of the Ark waiting for the Dove. His lizard curled up at his side. Ham sleeps. Shem sleeps too. In all creation, only Ila is awake. Out in a corner of

She squats in pain. Her forehead covered with sweat. She swallows a cry of pain. Terror lights her eyes. In ILA‘’S HUT Shem suddenly wakes. He feels for his mate. Nothing. He shoots up in bed and looks around. He scurries into
In the darkness he spots her sweat stained face. He rushes to her. Ila’s eyes tell him everything.
HAM‘’S HUT Shem covers Ham’s mouth and shakes him awake. Whispers:
It’s time. Ham nods. cur TO:

With pulleys the brothers hoist the raft into the sea. The splash wakes Japheth up on the roof. The boy locks down and sees Shem checking the small boat for leaks. Japheth scans the sky for the Dove. ON SHEM’S BOAT Everything seems set. Dawn arrives through the clouds. He signals silently to Ham. Ham rushes into ILA’S HUT Naameh holds Ila’s hand. She cools her brow with a wet cloth. Ham and Naameh help Ila up. cur TO: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Sure enough Noah is awake. His face is filled with absolute conviction.
Shem beckons Ila into the boat. Naameh starts to cry.
Fear not mother. We shall find each other in the new world.

They hug. Shem beckons again but something catches his eye. A tiny HERRING FISH leaps onto deck. It flaps around trying to breathe. Shem is bewildered. He reaches to pick it up when another fish leaps on board.
Japheth spots a speck on the horizon. The dove?
Shem stares at the dying fish. Beat. Ten more jump on board. Then, a whole school. He panics.

(to Tla) Get back! He looks over the side of the boat. From the dark purple sea a shape rises towards him. He leaps for the pulley ropes just as a giant ORCA smashes through the bow of the escape boat. A pod of whales follow close behind, cresting out of the sea everywhere, reducing the raft to splinters. Shem safely hangs on a rope. He scampers up into
Ila hugs him. He hugs back. Scared. The whales cry out as if talking to Noah. Shem sees his father watching. His anger grows but:
The Dove: The Dove! From

They hear Japheth scream. Everyone rushes outside. The exhausted bird fights to maintain altitude. It sinks, almost hits the water, then fights to get air. As it gets closer a wind picks up. JIla’s hair blows in the gust. The still waters of the sea are pushed into choppy foam. The Dove is buoyed the last few yards towards the Ark. It collapses onto the deck. Japheth rushes over. He picks up the bird. It pants, its chest heaves. He. examines the feet. Clean, no mud. Nothing there. Ila reads her young brother’s body language.
Nothing. Satisfied, Noah returns inside. Shem picks up a long wooden pole. Ham sees the fury.
(whispers) We do it now! Shem descends upon Noah. Ham follows with clenched fists.

Boys, NO! Outside of NOAH’S WORKSHOP Shem swings for the back of Noah’s neck. An inch from impact, Noah is ready. He spins around, blocks the weapon, twists his son’s wrist, tosses him to the ground. With Shem’s pole, he trips Ham and ping him down. Noah plants a knee onto the center of Shem’s chest. He stares into his son’s helpless eyes.
Tf it is a boy, it can live. But if it is a girl, it must die. Noah tosses Shem aside and disappears into his workshop.  107. } Shem tries to go in after him but Naameh and Ila hold h - back.
No, Shem, no. Just, then
The bottom of the ARK SCRAPES against an undersea mountaintop.
The jolt tosses everyone around. Ila screams as she hits the ground. Shem rushes to her side.
What was that?
We’ve run aground. Noah leaps out of his workshop. He rushes off to check the Ark. .
Oh my... Water leaks out from between her legs.
It‘s begun.
Mother. What’s happening?
Your water has broken. The baby moves under the sxin of Ila’s belly.
This can’t be, it’s too goon.
j Calm down daughter. It’s not too aa soon. It’s time. Shem springs to action. He looks to his brother.
Help me take her down!
Where?
Akkad’s old hideaway has been updated by Shem and Ham. The room is now a substantial defense. It is stocked with supplies. Shem and Ham carry Ila into a small
Naameh follows them in, surprised by what she sees.
What’s all this?
I knew he wouldn’t let them go.

We built it just in case. (softly to Ila) We will be safe here. We are armed and no one will touch you or our baby. Ila lets out her first cry of labor. The boys set her down on a mattress. Naameh cleans her hands. Then, she reaches under the blanket and into Ila. She focuses on what she feels.
All right. It is time. Baby is coming.
No, what do you mean? Please mother. He’s going to take my baby.
He won’t take our child.
Make it stop, make it--  4
A huge wave of pain comes. Ila grunts. It passes.
Please mother. Please, keep it inside.
It’s coming, daughter. Don’t think about anything else. Shem will protect us, Naameh hands her the blanket.
Bite down on this. When the pain comes, don’t scream, try to bite on this.
(confident) She can scream. I am ready. Shem goes outside to prepare. As another contraction arrives we Cur TO:
Noah examines the point of impact. Water slowly sprays into the ship. cur To:
Ila tries to bite the blanket but she can’t help herself and she howls. The whole ship hears it.
We hear her howls. The cries of childbirth echo past the sleeping animals and throughout the great ship.
Noah hears the cries. He lowers his eyes for he knows what he may soon have to do. cur TO:
ilo.
Japheth rushes in terrified by the cries. He claws at his mother wishing for comfort. .
Go outside son, outside. But Japheth won’t budge. Ila, between contractions now, s Naameh’s concern and Japheth’s fear. She smiles at him.
Sweet Japheth. Will you help me?
(through tears) How?
Bring me your bird.
Yest Go bring your sister what she asks. Japheth goes. A contraction hits Ila. She wrestles with the pain. Outside in the
Shem and Ham lower sharpened spears into a pit trap.

NOAH’S WORKSHOP Noah cleans his body, hands, and feet in a basin of cold water. He puts on a fresh clean robe. He straps a long sharp dagger to his waist. Another of Ila’s screams slices through the ship. Noah kneels on the ground and clasps his hands, He prays silently. Finally, we can just make out the words:
Please, please, let it be a boy.
tit.
Japheth returns with the Dove. Ila, between contractions, looks up at her baby brother.

Japheth, sweet brother. Take her to the roof and let her fly for home. One more time. Beg her to help. And wait for her. Don’t leave. You’ve got to stay up there and watch for her to return. Can you do that for me? I know you can. Japheth swells with pride. We follow Japheth through the Ark as he rushes past the OUTSIDE OF NOAH‘S WORKSHOP He almost smashes into his father. Japheth ignores him. Noah watches his son go. Noah carries a huge basket filled with mixed herbs down into the bowels of the ship.
The gray clouds glow with sun. Japheth rushes outside with the Dove.
Go now. Go find a safe place for my sister. He releases the bird into the sky. The Dove circles high above the Ark. Then, it flies off straight as an arrow.
The Ark floats in the distance. We rise off of the water and watch the Dove shoot past. Ila’s cries bring us back to the  112.
Naameh offers Ila some water. Labor is now deep upon the young woman.
Noah sparks his flint into the basket of herbs. They quickly start to smolder. Thick smoke rushes up inte the Ark.

SHEM’S FORT Armed, Shem paces back and forth like a caged animal. Waiting to protect his love. Ham crouches behind a barrel. He waits perfectly focused and still. The awl clenched in white-tipped fingers. Shem peeks out the door. still no sign of his father.
Japheth stares at the horizon. The Dove is long gone.
It’s coming. Shem!
Shem rushes in. Naameh is wild-eyed. So is Shem. They stare between Ila’s legs.
Careful now. I can feel the top of the head. There you see it? Shem doesn’t know how to answer.
I can’t, I can’t do this.
a
You can. You will. When you feel you have to push. You push.
I love you.
I love you. And then it happens. Ila feels the need to push. She bears down.
(to Shem) Go on now. He will be coming. Shem steps out into the
And stands ready by the main door. In his hiding place, Ham closes his eyes and tightens his grip.
Naameh can’t help but laugh.
I can feel it. I can feel the head. It’s coming out. Tla is rocked by a contraction.
Push! And Ila does.
Shem waits, TIla’s cries in the background. Then he spots his father. Noah stands silently on the other side of the wall of spears.
Son. Let me pass.
I will not.
I do not wish to harm you.
It is my baby!
It threatens every creature on this boat.

It? You mean your grandchild? My first born? Just leave us be! Noah almost grins. And then we hear a newborn CRY! Noah gets extremely serious. He shuts his eyes. A moment of reflection. Then, he looks at his son.
Please. You cannot stop us. Shem excited by the sound of fatherhood responds by unleashing a sword.
(unsure) Us? But Noah has retreated into the darkness of the Ark. CcUr TO:
Naameh smiles broadly as she hands the newborn baby to her mother. Ila sobs.
Shem watches the hallway, not sure where Noah went. He nervously screams into the lean-to.
Is it a boy? What is it?
a Nice” oa 115.
Ila looks up at Naameh - what is it?
(to Ila) I didn’t look. And Naameh peeks beneath the blanket keeping the baby warm. We do not see the sex, but by the look on Naameh’s face the news is not good.
(gasps) Oh no. Naameh tries to lie the best she can.
(shouting to Shem) It’s a boy! SHEM’S FORT Shem can barely believe his ears.
A boy? A boy?!
Yes a boy! Shem sees Noah approaching down the hall.
It is a boy. Stop. It is a boy. But Noah strides forward. And now, Shem hears the sounds of the Ark awakening behind him.
We watch the creatures rise from their slumber. They stumble to their hooves, their paws, their flippers. Eyes open, they stretch and yawn and let out their morning cries.

Noah pushes forward. Ham watches from his hiding place. As Noah passes, Ham rises up, murderous AWL in hand. The blade rushes down towards the back of Noah’s head. This is not about stopping Noah. Not about saving the baby. This is about hatred and revenge.

But from the darkness of the Ark something comes. Two hulking three-horned RHINOS charge Ham. One tosses Ham into a wall. He collapses out cold. The Rhinos charge on. They smash apart Shem’s wall of spears but the trap surprises them. They tumble down into the pit of spikes. Their species forever extinct. Just on the tail of the rhinos is a myriad of species two by two. They storm the fortress. The BIRDS and BATS and flying INSECTS reach Shem first. He swings at them but they teem about, confusing and disorienting him. Shem’s swinging traps impale one of two giant predator CATS. The other one leaps onto Shem’s chest. Shem pulls out a new blade and stabs the cat in its lungs. He tosses the carcass aside. Noah moves forward surrounded by the swarm of creatures attacking Shem.

IT’S A BO¥! A BOY!!! STOP! Noah keeps coming. Shem pulls a trigger unleashing darts and arrows at Noah. The flying creatures sacrifice themselves. Many die. Noah keeps walking. Two SPOTTED WOLVES charge. Shem retreats into
And he sees his beautiful child for the first time. But something is wrong. Ila and Naameh are both crying.  an ad
Isn’t she beautiful?

She? For a moment he chokes up. As he pulls himself together and hoists another weapon the hut is yanked apart. Two giant RIDGE-BACKED PRIMATES rip the hut to pieces. The morning glow from outside shines on Ila and the child. The primates descend on Shem and push him to the ground. The wolves growl at and bite Shem until all he can do is crawl up into a defensive ball in the corner. Noah stops before Ila. Naameh pounds on his chest.

It’s a boy for mercy’s sake. A BOY! Noah lowers his sobbing wife to the floor. Two giant FANGED HOGS pin her gently to the ground. And now there’s just Noah and Ila. Ila shivers in the dawn. The pain of childbirth still rattles her inner core. she holds the baby tight.
Is it a girl? Ila can’t lie. She tears up.

Please father. NOAH : . I am sorry. The snakes on board hiss in. They grab her limbs and tighten spreading her down to the ground. Shem tries to do something but he is beaten back by the living breathing animals wandering everywhere. Ila is pinned.
No. No! Noah takes the child. His grandchild. He undresses her. It is a girl. Tears in his eyes. He swallows them down,  118.
I am sorry daughter. I am so sorry: He turns his back to Ila. He takes a deep breath.
I beg you please, I beg you-—~ He pulls out his dagger.
Ple-- Abhhh! Ila screams. Noah lifts the blade, then stops. Something is wrong. Ila cries from pain, not anguish. He looks back at her.
What? Naameh realizes first.
Another. A twin! A twin! Noah looks at the baby in his arm. He looks at the blade. He does not know what to do. The snakes let her loose. Noah moves towards Ila.
Get away from me! You monster! Away! She tries to back away. A wall of pain hits Ila, she nearly passes out.
Let me help her. Noah looks at the pigs. They release Naameh. She crawls to Ila.
A boy. Please a grandson.
It’s coming. And Ila pushes hard. Shem cries.

Please. Please. Please.  119. Naameh pulls the baby out. And she starts to sob. Noah looks at Naameh, he understands. But he forces the tears down. He reaches down and takes the second newborn child. He holds both babies in one arm. They wail relentlessly. Their screams are piercing. He picks them up and walks out of the room. Ila reaches for him, but she is exhausted, too weak to st cur TO:
Noah walks to the edge of the Ark and stares out at the sea. The clouds are dark and gently churning.
Forgive me. He collects himself and pulls out the blade. The knife hesitates and vibrates in the air. The babies scream and scream and scream.
(quietly and gently) Father. He turns and sees his daughter. She stands behind him. Weak but firm.
Please child. Go. You don’t need to see this. Ila drags herself forward, step by step.
(gently) You cannot stop me. Ila is close now. She looks at the screaming wailing children in her father’s arms.

They’re crying. Don’t let them die crying. Please. I can’t stop you. Iwon’t. Just- let me hold them? Calm them for a moment. Please? Let them die calm? Noah looks at Ila. She is telling the truth. ‘The children wail uncontrollably.

Let them know a moment of peace. Noah nods. Ila steps forward and takes the children. She holds the twins tightly. Shem and Naameh stumble onto deck and stare. With the babies in her arms, Ila drops to her knees. She stares down at them, rocking slowly back and forth. Laughing, crying. And then Ila starts to hum. Her voice rises up from a place of comfort so deep she doesn’t know its source. And she starts to sing:

Sleep my child. Surrender to the wild. Find your breath. Find your peace. Sleep my child, Surrender to the wild. Find your breath. Find your peace... Noah recognizes the song. It is the same tune he sang to his children. The same tune he sang to Ila as a little girl when her belly was bleeding and full of fear. The song calmed Ila then and it calms her daughters now. She rocks and sings. The infants whimper and soon they fall silent. Calm and at peace they stare up at their mother. Tears stream down her face, Ila holds out her arms to Noah. She offers up the quiet babies to his dagger.

Do it now. Do it quickly. Noah looks down at his daughter kneeling before him, offering her children, willing to hold them and watch them die in her arms rather than let them suffer. She looks up at Noah with a pleading face. A tear in her eye refracts sunlight. A rainbow in a drop of salty water as it beads and falls. Noah turns and looks at the skies. His eyes narrow from the brightness. The clouds have finally separated and blue sky pokes through. He watches as a rainbow emerges out from this air. Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet stretch down from the heavens into the shining sea.
The knife drops. It clangs against the floor of the Ark, Ila looks up. She sees her broken father. Crying.

(to himself, to the Creator) Iocan’t. I can’t do it. I am sorry. I am so sorry. Ila hugs the babies against her bosom. Shem holds tight onto his woman and children. Naameh reaches out for Noah, but he stumbles off. And then Japheth comes running.

There! There! There she is! Everyone looks. It is the Dove. He flies straight and strong. Japheth holds out his hand. The Dove lands in his palm. In its beak an olive twig, green leaves white flowers.
Land! He found it! Tla smiles at her younger brother.
Yes. He found it. Behind her, entering

Goes Noah. He heads into the belly of the ship. His family celebrates behind him. cur To: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Noah closes the door in his workshop. Defeated. He sits heavily. He cries out in anguish and punches the air.  d
Og’s box falls by itself to the floor. It smashes open and the old gnarled branch rolls to Noah’s feet. The branch has new life. Fresh green leaves have sprouted from the old grey wood.

The same gnarled branch. Now the root of a huge grape vine teeming with fruit. Butterflies, bees, and hummingbirds buzz around it. A foot steps in front. It is Ham’s foot. Ham wears a big pack. It looks like he is heading off on a long trip. He looks around him. There is a grape arbor. And a wine- press. Some empty jugs. He holds a knife in his hand. cur To:

Or what Eden must have been like in its first moments of creation. The waters have retreated. The Ark leans against a mountain top decaying. The sides of the Ark have been ripped down. Animals roam freely. Birds fill the sky. A new forest has taken seed. The buds of an approaching Spring burst forth boldly from young trees. A small camp around a small fire. Ila and Shem hold the young twins. They are wrapped warm from the dissipating cold. Japheth is fascinated with the girls. Naameh is busy working, cooking. She looks up concerned.
Ham?
